cons: Long sales cycle, need marketing help to get the product to the masses

pros: Had some great experiences outside my department
cons: My manager was not very honest and upfront.

headline: N/A
pros: Great place to work. It is good
cons: I don't have any cons to put.

headline: Amazing Place to Work
pros:
The people - Everyone is friendly and team oriented. We collaborate and help each other to make sure everyone succeeds.
Wonderful Culture and Values- Couchbase truly cares about their people
Training- Provide great training that increases your knowledge of our product/competition
cons: I have no cons at this time

headline: Good company
pros: Good product, good commissions, great benefits
cons: Low base pay, low brand awareness, growing pains of a start up

headline: Great place to work
pros:
- Exciting and complex product.
- Lots to learn. NOSQL, k8s, containers, linux, bash, to name a few.
- Supportive and caring management.
- Lots of growth opportunities. 
- Good engineers get promoted. 
- Great mentorship.
- Work with exceptionally smart engineers.
cons: The perks could be better.

headline: Great Culture
pros: Great people and product. All the people are nice and friendly. Execs too. Good about telling us how we are doing. Where we are going to go, etc. Sometimes need to make faster decision. They really care about the people and how we feel. This is a great company!
cons:
LOW pay and overall pay. Low base plus low bonus. Pay not made up at review. And RSU's low too
Not good holidays. Should be more
Information passing is sometimes not good.

headline: Awesome Place to Work
pros: Wonderful culture! Awesome team! Always exciting meetings with cross functional teams.
cons: Nothing...absolutely great place to work

headline: Love being here... what a new growth company should be
pros: Very much a people first company - they care about culture
cons: Still maturing with onboarding process, but doesn't present negative issues

headline: Quality company with great people
pros: Very interesting work. Excellent co-workers. Quality product in a strong and growing market. Management really cares about doing the right thing for customers and for employees.
cons: Could do a bit better with technical onboarding. As is true of many small- to medium-size companies, some "day to day" technical knowledge isn't well documented. Not a big deal, but an area for improvement.

headline: So far, it's a community of people who want to work hard and well together.
pros: Communication is clear and frequent. People are welcoming and open.
cons: Meetings often go over allotted time.

headline: Awesome company that genuinely cares about its people!
pros: Couchbase really walks the talk on their culture, and demonstrating that it cares about its people.  When Covid19 hit the U.S. they stepped up to engage with people, were early to close their offices and stop travel to protect their people, and took care to hold more frequent CEO-led talks with the entire company and do virtual fun events.
cons: I honestly have no cons.

headline: Fabulous Place to Work!!!
pros: The culture is second to none. Happy people who make for Happy customers.  The executive team is available and they listen to their employees.  Our core value is "Be a Good Human". Who can top that?
cons: So far so good.  I thought I might get jaded but it has not happened yet.  Love working here!

headline: Great Place to Work
pros: Everyone is so helpful, there is a real sense of teamwork, that you are part of something great! The product actually performs and we have a vast amount of customers that we have helped with their mission critical applications.
cons: I don't have any yet!

headline: Fantastic Place to Work - Influential CoWorkers
pros: Employees are highly motivated by competition. Has a friendly yet hard working environment while trying to achieve the next big achievement and taking over as the #1 Database company in our space. Matt Cain and the rest of top management has been a great boss and the trickle down is apparent.
cons: Have been moved and compensation for moving wasn't given. As this is a smaller company, the training for particular roles just hasn't been developed enough, so learning in the earlier stages of your career can be difficult if you aren't a go-getter.

headline: Good Values
pros: Shared common values that benefit the individual and the company at the same time. People really like the product making it easy to talk to people about it.
cons: N/A at this time o

headline: Growing Database Space
pros: Solid company!  Leader in NoSQL DB for performance, scalability, ease of management, cross datacenter replication, multi-cloud/Kubernetes data management and mobile endpoints.
cons: Lots of customer whitespace with many legacy traditional relational database and mainframe environments.

headline: Fantastic Work Culture
pros: Pleasant, helpful coworkers. Good benefits. I especially love the company benefits card allowance.
cons: I have no cons at this time.

headline: Best Place to Work:  Couchbase
pros: The Products, The People, The Energy, The Work, The Company
cons: No Cons; Only Positive Experiences

headline: This is a really great place to work
pros: Everyone is super friendly and accessible no matter the rank or department
cons: Honestly none from my experience

headline: Great Coworkers, Highly Innovative Database Technology
pros:
A purpose built cloud oriented document database built for and marketed to the Enterprise.

If you are into cloud databases (at-scale, analytics, NoSQL, and full text search) you will find it all here in a unified product portfolio at this exciting late stage and growing startup to work at.

There is no micromanaging at Couchbase, you are trusted to get your work done and also encouraged to contribute and collaborate outside your functional areas. In my short time at Couchbase I have seen numerous people make large impacts in improving the core product capabilities and also solving difficult customer challenges that other competing products fail at.

The culture at Couchbase promotes a sense of family for lack of a better term, everyone is both approachable and focused on helping each other and the company succeed.  Very open and transparent culture it's nice to know where the company stands both strategically and financially.
cons: None have  surfaced to date

headline: Great process
pros: Very organized, well planned, and great, helpful attitude among the employees.
cons: I haven't run across any yet.

headline: Passionate professional people
author_position: Director of Product Marketing and Evangelism
pros:
Couchbase is a company on the leading edge of technology, one of the best kept secrets in the industry
Competitive Salary
Good benefits
Smart people
Excellent orientation
cons:
No 401k matching
Still making the transition from traditional Enterprise software to Cloud 
Culturally need to manage what is a meeting and what is a slack/email a bit better
(but overall very good, nothing is perfect)

headline: My Experience at Couchbase
pros: Inclusive and positively charged culture. Self motivated individuals excited to progress in their respective fields. Managers always looking to encourage and provide opportunities for success.
cons: Perks are on par, not above average for similar sized technology companies.

headline: Great place to work
pros:
- Building a great product with immense potential.
- Plenty of opportunities for career growth.
- Direct management understands the importance of work/life balance.
- The company is building a great team.
cons: none that I'm currently aware of.

headline: Great Product, Great People, Great Timing
pros:
Great People
Engaged Executive Team 
Benefits are awesome
Resonable Goals
cons: None that I can think of...

headline: High people turn over rate
pros: Nice colleagues. Missing Thursday free lunches!
cons: Restricted growth. Less chances to be promoted.

headline: Good Company
pros: Good Product, lot of opportunity for growth
cons: Did not find any cons as such,

headline: Great Company
pros: Very attentive to your growth, success, and happiness
cons: no cons to think of

headline: Growing company
pros: Diversified cultures and friendly in general
cons: Some inconsistent and slow teams

headline: initial impressions
pros: I have found in my first 5 months that the decision to join Couchbase was a great one. This is a company that is truly focused on Success. Not only the success of the company but our employees and customers as well. Couchbase has demonstrated the willingness to do great things for employees. In one case one we found a way to help an employee to go help his family for several months during a crisis rather than accept his resignation we helped make it work and now he is back. Our employees are willing to do what it takes for the company to be successful. During a time when it took us longer to get a new position filled another employee from another group jumped in to help. The relationship between the Sales Team and Technical Team is really great at Couchbase. We are able to work together to get deals closed rather than fight over whose job it is.
cons: Unlike many of the large companies I have worked for not every situation has been vetted and documented. This does give us the freedom to look at individual situations and just do what is best for everyone

headline: Helpful and caring coworkers driven by amazing values
pros: The company tries to provide you with all the resources required to onboard without even asking and most people are quick to respond. Everyone is highly professional about their work. Free lunch on Thursday and stacked snack counter is a huge plus.
cons: They can improve on the 401K benefits.

headline: Amazing company with industry leading technology and superlative  employee and customer focus
pros: Great people and really supportive culture that treats people with respect and as adults.  Wicked snack & drink selection too .  Well established leaders, top talent across the board, and an exciting & evolving future in a large market with tremendous upside.  I can't believe all the incredible use cases for our product and the huge impact we can make in customers' lives.  This is the best kept secret in all of technology...not just the database sector.  Check out the most recent Forrester Wave report on market leaders in the Big Data and NoSQL space.  Simply stated, Couchbase is the solution for mission critical applications.  It allows you to do things competitors can't do and they back the product up with world class talent.
cons: We've had normal and painful turnover one sees at a company moving from startup to a more establish growth company.  This impacted business outcomes earlier in the year but leadership has stabilized the team and business projections since, so things are really looking on the up and up!

headline: Serious engineering, opportunities for impact, relaxed, mature culture
pros:
Engineering: as a database company, Couchbase has a serious engineering culture, performance and reliability are critical to our customers. I really like the seriousness and studiousness with which the team approaches engineering problems.

Impact: After working at a vastly larger company, it was great to come work at Couchbase where I could have an idea for a feature, come up with a proof-of-concept, and get it into the customers' hands  in only a few months' time. As a small company, there is a lot of opportunity to have significant short-term impact.

Culture: a lot of the engineering staff have been around, and worked at a lot of places, giving the feeling that there are adults in charge, yet this also means that a lot of people have families and understand that you have a life outside of engineering. There is definitely an appreciation for getting things done more than just putting hours in, I really do feel that I can "work smarter not harder."
cons: Culture does vary quite a bit between teams, different people may have different experiences.

headline: Great People, Great Technology, Winning Business Model
pros: What drew me to Couchbase was the technology initially, what's been the most rewarding has been the people and the constant sense that it's a company on the right track and headed for great success.   As a support VP I've rarely had the experience to work at a place where all of the organizations involved seemed to 100% aligned and in tune like I find at Couchbase.  The teams are energetic, committed and amazingly all trying to do the right thing, in the end, for the customer first.   That's true right from the CEO on down.   Definitely one of the best experiences I've had in my career.
cons: The only con for me is that it's not HQ'ed in San Francisco.   Beyond that it would be hard for me to point to something that is a downside for me.

headline: Ownership and Community
pros:
- We all want to get buy in when moving forward with a particular project or program. When you get buy-in at Couchbase, it's about SUPPORT, not PERMISSION. You're trusted to do the work you were hired in to do, and the teams here WANT to enable and embolden you to do your best.
- Couchbase, as a community, prioritizes family - whether that's the family you're born in to, the family you choose, or the family you identify with - and understands that your priorities often lie with them - AND THAT'S AWESOME! Because of this, we enjoy flexible hours and caring people all around.  The DTO (Discretionary Time Off) policy also supports this.
- Couchbase prioritizes internal candidates - so if you're looking to find opportunities for your career to evolve, this could be a great choice.
- Highly approachable executive leadership
cons: - Moving from Mountain View to Santa Clara in the fall - A fantastic move for most Silicon Valley employees, but maybe not perfect for people coming from San Francisco

headline: Growth and opportunities
pros:
Thus far, Couchbase has been a great place to work. What I really enjoy are the benefits/perks, as well as the opportunity, which is the main reason I came to the company. There is so much room for growth, as you are enabled to take on many different projects, and have lots of opportunity to make a difference and lead in your own way.  As the company grows, I feel like I have the opportunity to make an impact and grow with the company which is important. I also feel as though my opinion matters, and my thoughts are heard, and that is something that makes me feel like I play an integral role at the company. 

Additionally, you would think at a start-up that work/life balance is non existent, but at Couchbase I find that I can easily balance my work and life, and I have the flexibility to do so. 

There are also some really great leaders, and great leaders is what keeps great, high performing employees.
cons:
- No 401k match 
- Pay could be better, but it's not too bad

headline: Start a Revolution!
pros: #1 The people.  Simply the best bunch of workmates in my career: smart, creative, fun, committed,  team players.  #2 Our customers.  They LOVE our product: it does what we say it will do,  and more, so they can't wait to tell the world about it!  #3.  The technology.  Changing the world is easy to talk about, but our product team is actually delivering a data platform that is doing it.  #4.  The market opportunity.  It's huge: multiple billions of $$$ are spent in our space and we've only just begun.  #5.  Our financials.  Even better on the inside than it looks from the outside.  Watch out world!
cons: Not really a con, but if you're expecting an easy ride, look elsewhere:  everyone pulls their weight, so expectations are high.  As with all start-ups, agility is the name of the game, so be prepared to jump on new opportunities as they emerge.

headline: This company is special
pros: Aside from being pre-IPO, this is a different type of company in terms of culture than most tech companies.  The culture here is HIGHLY collaborative and there aren't a lot of politics.  The CEO doesn't believe in org charts, so that tells you how horizontal this place is.  The folk here are GOOD PEOPLE that want to win, it's that simple.  Integrity, open communication, and respect seem to be highly valued.  People here are smart, the guy who invented SQL just joined.  Don't miss an opportunity to work at this company.
cons: None that I have observed yet.  The company is run in a very fiscally prudent way, so you have to have a solid business case in place to get budget.

headline: A rare company with great culture and focus
pros: Everyone tries to do the right thing. Management makes courageous and necessary decisions as opposed to expedient ones. There is an inherent culture of effective communication across teams and the expectation is that we are all on the same team without internal divisions. The CEO sets the tone by being very direct, honest, and focused on the right goals to become a successful business.
cons: Not a con really- there's no hype or out-of-control spending on flashy and lavish things (although we do have a very well-stocked kitchen). If you're just around for the short-term flash and perks that some startups seem to advertise as being a selling point, this isn't the place for you. The culture here is focused on long-term growth and viability.

headline: Good potential...
pros:
- Couchbase creates amazing technology that can really change many things (obviously for regulars and even for many techies, Couchbase as name does not ring the bell) 
- There are definitely a lot of opportunities to wear multiple hats and pick up new skills as long you are willing to do so.
- Great engineering team that is always willing to help solving even non-engineering problems!   
- Solid CEO who has pretty straight forward plans. 
- Office in SF in addition to Mountain View if you live in the city
cons:
- Lack of transparency (right hand does not see what left hand is doing)
- Too many Directors and VPs
- Lack of life/work balance for certain teams/people. Emails/IMs are being sent pretty much 24/7 with expectations that things will be fixed right away

headline: So far, so good
pros: The enthusiasm of a relatively new leadership team, including new CEO, is infectious.  There are various perks like Community Lunch Thursdays where lunch is catered --and colleagues actually all sit together and connect. It's a great environment where "self starters" can thrive with the correct amount of autonomy and support provided by leadership.
cons: Couchbase plays in a crowded space, although it's not a con about the company itself. If someone is looking to work for a pink, fluffy unicorn on its own rainbow, this wouldn't be the place. But if someone is looking at an opportunity to help make a difference in a highly competitive space, this is it.

headline: Fast Paced,Genuine Culture & Hard Working
pros:
Smart and hard working teams striving to make a great product. They do have a customer-centric focus and work hard to deliver a product that can change how companies deliver business value.  

They are constantly trying to improve their internal processes and have lots of discussions on how it can be accomplished. Very inclusive culture, transparent, mature and they do what it takes to make both customers and employees successful. Great experience so far!

Providing great tools that allow us to do our jobs as effectively as possible has been a notable change from my previous positions and they focus on accountability as well as ownership---which is awesome.
cons: Not really a con, but something to note. The interview process can be lengthy as they want to ensure they find the right fit for each position.

headline: Do your homework before joining
pros: Technology is pretty good in targeted use cases. Hot space. Great location. Nice HQ building.
cons: All of the smart people have left. CEO and company does not believe in paying for strong performance. Board should have ousted the CEO a few years ago. There was a great sales team and sales leadership in place 3 years ago, then CEO showed his true colors and brought in a safe, very wrong choice to lead the team. All good sales people have left or are in the process of leaving. The company literally does not believe in paying commissions or rewarding top performers. When top sale people leave without even waiting for their owed commissions...that is a clear message.

headline: Solutions Engineer - PreSales
pros: Great product and people.  Makes life so much easier when you have a great product that you honestly believe in.  Culture is very techy with freedom.  Very customer focused.  Great roadmap.  **The future looks bright**
cons: Very fast moving company with a rapid product development cycle.  Great for customers and our feature set.  Sometimes a bit difficult to keep up.  And information has to constantly be kept up to date.  They do a good job of this, but you must future employees must be a person who can keep up with a fast-paced company/product line.

headline: Very much enjoying it.
pros:
Love the startup culture, where things get done fast, and I'm able to play an influential role in helping the company meet its goals and plan for the future.  Coming from a large, bureaucratic company, where it took a long time for things to get decided on and implemented, it's very refreshing to be in a fast-paced environment where the company can act quickly and strategically.
People are respectful of each other, and value the contributions each of us in "getting stuff done".
cons: Only "con" would be that it can sometimes be a challenge to figure out "who's who", given that the company is growing so rapidly (adding many new faces).  Not really a negative --  its a sign of the success and fast growth.

headline: Fun, exciting NoSQL Startup
pros: Positive small-company atmosphere. Good, decent people for colleagues and more than our fair share of very capable individuals. People are well-intentioned, care and work hard. Yes there are support tickets and bugs to fix but it's a real product with real customers using it heavily -- so these things are only to be expected. Everything is not perfect all the time but on balance this is a great place to be.
cons: Work can be demanding at times (though in general no "nights and weekends" nonsense.) We're still a start-up so there's the existential risk that goes with that territory.

headline: A wonderful atmosphere to make impactful changes
pros: As a developer I moved here from a large company where opportunities to make meaningful changes were as rare as discovering penicillin. Here I find that nearly everything I do can and will immediately be applied to a paying customer usecase! And with Couchbase customer base comprising of most of the biggest brand names in almost every sector, be it retailers or credit unions or travel websites, chances are the stuff I do is immediately going to be used by a very huge number of people!
cons: Free lunch only one day of the week.

headline: Great people, amazing product
pros: We get to work on ground-breaking technology that our customers love; LOVE my co-workers; there are lateral and upward mobility opportunities if you work for them; company has tremendous growth potential; we’re in the right stage of the company for anyone to come in and make a big impact; work-life balance is great; the management team takes the time to recognize and reward employees; management is very open with employees on business health
cons: There are the typical growing pains of a fast-moving startup to midsize company plus new leadership team

headline: Great company culture. There is a genuiness to most everyone
pros: Start up that is serious about its vision and the next stage. No big egos, everyone in our department wants to teach and learn because they all have the same goal.
cons: Lunches are truly lacking. I hear that this will soon change as the new VP of HR is great and really listens to suggestions.

headline: Need technical direction not policies
pros: HR is quite active on Glassdoor, playing the saving grace. Please read their 5 star reviews for the "pros".
cons: Like someone here clearly mentioned, we need more engineers than managers. There are too many managers, directors, sr. directors who are busy challenging each other, stepping into each other's territory, eventually ending up being counter-productive to the engineering teams. Loyalist culture is gradually taking root.

headline: Why have so many people left Couchbase?
pros:
- Very nice people at the individual contributor level, as well as some in management.
- Office very well designed and comfortable to work in
cons: Looking back on my own experience at Couchbase I am struck by the astonishing talent exodus at the company available for anyone to see on LinkedIn. While I was there the management politics were cut-throat, information was hoarded and  the atmosphere was rife with secrecy and paranoia that obstructed productivity and drove talented employees out the door. There was little attempt that I saw by management to curb any of this, or even to acknowledge it was happening. To this day I am still being alerted to congratulate former employees on their new positions at other companies, so perhaps not much has changed.

headline: Rapid growth, more opportunity, exciting times
pros: Although small, the group of people working at Couchbase are among the smartest and most dedicated. Everyone really believes in the product and celebrates wins together. There are get togethers and lunches that foster great culture, not to mention an always full kitchen with anything you might need.
cons: The benefits could use some improvement and expansion, that looks to be on the roadmap in the future.

headline: Limitless opportunity in fast-growing, pre-IPO company – that’s fun to go to every day!
pros: I have found Couchbase to be a fast-paced, high-energy environment where I can work hard, take on challenges, and be rewarded for my efforts. My colleagues are supportive of one another and I have experienced little to no politics. It has all the right ingredients for a great company: brilliant technology/product, fantastic leadership team, awesome market opportunity, as well as fun, smart and talented people.
cons: I would love to see better beer options (maybe a pilsner) from the keg.

headline: Awesome place to work!
pros: Fast paced environment .. no bureaucracy and office politics .. Everything is said at face value.. Everyone takes an interest in all work done by individual teams... Lots of transparency at work. Brilliant co-workers who are very humble and always willing to help.. Lots of opportunity to learn.
cons: No cons really. Just need to work hard to keep up with all the brilliant employees that work here.

headline: Opportunity to make big impact in a big space.
pros:
If you're into databases, enterprise systems, and are passionate to see customers succeed, you have a great opportunity to make a big impact. Database work is at the convergence lot of things in CS: Apps to AI, storage to the cloud.  Expect to work great people, learn a lot, and progress.

Couchbase has enterprise-focused products and a growing set of customers. Good balance between open source community and enterprise model.
cons: Create waves, not just ride them.

headline: Sales
pros: Software built the right way stands the test of time. Couchbase counts many of the worlds biggest brands that will be able to stay competitive with such a comprehensive database that includes the first NoSQL mobile offering.
cons: Even though we have the big brand names, Couchbase is not well known.  Very much a start-up still which means lot's of work to be done.  If you thrive in constant change, and very strong work ethic...then you will thrive.

headline: Starting a data revolution
pros: Just started < 6 months ago, and there are definitely growing pains of a startup trying to be a grown-up, but the management team is strong and allows you to seek and solve problems to better the business...  With technology outpacing the competition, it's an exciting time to be on-board @ CB!
cons: Those "growing pains" in older tools are still in place, but change is coming!

headline: Great Place, Real Work
pros: For engineers, at least, there are zero politics and reasonable expectations about the dent you can make in a mountain of work we have ahead of us.
cons: It is more a collection of individuals than a mature company (not a bad thing necessarily), so don't expect a lot of extra hand-holding -- you have to figure a few things out yourself.

headline: Experiencing hyper growth and accelerating momentum
pros: Very open and transparent culture.  Approachable and willing to share what is happening in the business...both good and bad.  Weekly 'community lunch' where everyone eats together like a family.   Building a strong leadership culture, with continued strong talent being brought in.
cons: The usual 'growing pains' private companies experience during a period of extreme growth.

headline: Opportunity to learn and have an impact
pros: I've been at Couchbase about a year and really enjoy it.  There are numerous areas where it's possible to define problems and solution, all leading to creating a significant impact for both our customers and the company itself.  The company is expanding and our customers have some amazing use cases built around Couchbase.
cons: Some of our IT systems are a bit legacy, but that seems to be changing with the new IT team.

headline: Senior Software Engineer
pros:
Good product that has picked up traction among customers.
Flexibility in selecting projects and moving between teams within engineering.
Mostly humble engineers. Main engineering project manager has excellent collaboration and technical skills.
cons:
I see what looks like fake five star reviews from HR here. Obviously, someone felt a need to polish their image on glassdoor.
Not much focus on hiring top level engineering talent.
Some other departments seem to get lot more attention as compared to engineering, which actually builds the product.
Lack of open discussion on platform choices, lack of rigorous discussion on engineering direction.

headline: Enterprise Sales
pros: Excellent technology, with an ever expanding use case portfolio.  Customer base is full of household names with mission critical apps in production.  Company is taking a very smart approach to the market opportunity building a rock solid architecture with conservative growth.
cons: Startup growing pains associated with communication as global footprint grows.  Marketing and Community are behind competition utilizing social media to build long term developer advocacy.

headline: Great potential and great place to work
pros:
Great people, culture, technology and market potential.
The customers love the solution and customer success mindset which is proven by probably the highest renewal rate in the industry category.
cons: typical challenges of keeping the balance in a high growth rate market

headline: Enterprise Sales Rep
pros: Couchbase is a great culture, and they want to pay their reps. The product works, the Solution Engineers are great. It is a customer centric company, and growing smartly.
cons: It is not perfect. They make mistakes. They respond to those mistakes.

headline: Great to be in a focused company, on a "change the world" team
pros: Great people to work with. Smart, dedicated, communicative, diverse, and focused.
cons: It's a startup. Things change. If change and asking yourself "What can we do differently or better?" isn't your cup of tea, then this is probably not the best place for you.

headline: Great company. Transparent culture.
pros: Great product. Great technical and support folks. Marketing has improved a lot over the course of the past 2 years under new leadership. Should help branding significantly and help get us to the scale where we can IPO.
cons: Some change as a result of new leadership, but expected and most of it is positive.

headline: performance engineer
pros: great group of technology forward people.   base technology is excellent,  but they  are out marketed by similar offerings.
cons: simply no attempt to reach a common goal definition resulting in groups in a destructive competitive environment, resulting in too many people being pushed aside and high turnover.  and it is all laughingly dismissed as growing pains of a pre-IPO startup.  unnecessary! and   unproductive!

headline: Technology, Salary and great people to work with
pros: People, People and People. I rest my case.
cons: A few based on bay are standards of perks, but nothing serious which would make me walk away.

headline: Great Experience
pros:
Friendly work environment and is a place to feel appreciated

Salesforce instance runs almost flawlessly and is incredibly well built to handle all of the needs and asks from the sales team as well as its numerous integrations to software 

(Mostly) Incredibly smart and helpful co-workers who are very friendly and easy to approach 

Solving real problems that help teams and people immediately
cons:
Lazy People in some departments and having to do their work for them 

Too much investment in legacy sales software that doesn’t produce real measurable ROI

WittyParrot

headline: Great technology, great people!
pros: The technology is rock solid and very relevant.  The culture is positive and encourages intelligent/thoughtful risk-taking.
cons: Like all start-ups, whether early or late stage, there is plenty of pressure to deliver and perform at the highest levels.  If you thrive in that type of environment, you'll do well here.

headline: Sales
pros: Great culture and future vision as well as tenured leadership. Management has a great handle on the market; what is working and what needs to change.
cons: Newer technology will take some time to become a standard with many old school brick and mortar clients. Adoption will be key to success.

headline: Bad company to work for, little perks, terrible leadership, and no loyalty, if people don’t like you, you will be fired.
pros: Free snacks not many pros I can tell you about, some cool co workers but most are all the same type as leadership.
cons: Bad leadership across the board, I saw so much turnover and unhappy people. I also saw people who work very hard for the company to be let go due to not being in the boys club. I would not recommended, the pay way below market, under value employees and it is not run like a start up today, most people come from veritas and old companies like that, trying to implement the same structure and culture and does not work.

headline: Great company, every day is different!
pros: Things are different on a daily basis, which keeps the job exciting and new. Easy product to be passionate about since it is the best NoSQL products out there.
cons: Located in Mountain View, so a sizable commute for San Franciscans.

headline: NoSQL= No Commissions
pros: Product shines in some use cases, and is able to complete at times with other no SQL database solutions. Good marketing spin makes up for a lot.
cons: Long technical sale cycles. Freeware version more than applicable in most use cases.  Company is run by operations which largely overshoots sales quotas and limits sales commissions. Evidence being that the comp plan has had to be adjusted two years in a row.

headline: Excellent company to work for.
pros: Great product. Smart technical team. Strong management team with clear vision. Friendly co-workers.  Positive atmosphere.  I look forward to going to work every day.
cons: None that I can think of at this time.

headline: Fast growing and exciting company
pros: great product, great teams, leading edge technology in a fast growing market segment.
cons: fast paced, need to know how to prioritize to avoid burning out

headline: Supportive Environment and Great Growth Potential
pros: Great support from leadership. Organized and focused on its bright future. FUN, energetic culture
cons: There are the usually cons associated with late stage startups

headline: Supportive, Flexible and Great Opportunities
pros:
* flexible timing
* very supportive and friendly colleagues. 
* detail discussions on every small details of implementation.
* people are technical.
cons: * missing everyday lunch compared to previous job.

headline: Sales manager
pros: Great culture, great product & roadmap, great people. Customers and internal individuals are listened!
cons: Profitable growth VC objective request people to be more efficient/productive but i's worth it!

headline: Nickel and Dimed
pros: Very strong technology to compete in very crowded database space
cons: Deals are hard enough to find and sell-but once you do they figure out a way to screw their sales people - they do not pay at industry levels and they are incredibly devious in the ways they figure out how not to pay their sales people

headline: Senior Software Engineer
pros:
- Colleagues are nice, humble, intelligent and helpful people.
- Company is doing well thanks to good engineers.
cons:
- Compensation is not up to bay area standards. Recruiters won't hesitate to use immigration as 
   an excuse to low-ball you in your negotiations.
- Management won't hesitate to lie to their engineers about interesting work. I was told during my 
   negotiation that I should look at this job as an investment and low-balled me in my basic salary. I 
   am not getting to do interesting work. Again, I was lied to.

headline: A Sales Team That is Rapidly Disintegrating
pros: A company that used to foster a sense of teamwork and a great product.
cons:
New sales leadership has gutted sales of the best reps. Sales leadership is running a manic plan with no room for creativity, very much a "my way or the highway".  All of this has led to an exodus of sales staff.

Politics have also invaded the company which makes collaboration nearly impossible with retaliation and backstabbing running amok.

headline: Disconnect between Glassdoor reviews and reality....
pros: Nice office with good location, free snacks, people at lower levels are generally nice and smart
cons: Huge push by executives to say that there is no hierarchical culture and it's time they wake up and look around.  internal politics rampant.  Lack of inspirational leadership.  Transparency and communication to staff happens only when messages are highly scripted and scrubbed. Command and control leadership style no matter how much they try to say the opposite.  Don't try to make changes here, there will be consequences.

headline: Awesome company
author_position: Senior Director, Quality Engineering, Performance & Build
pros:
Fantastic company to work for
Technical competence
cons: Benefits package can be improved

headline: Fantastic Place to work for
pros: Fantastic Sales team. Great transformation from Caching solution to Database platform
cons: None I can think of

headline: Quick onboarding, amazing team
pros: Invested team, terrific focus and excitement as we grow.
cons: none have come to light yet

headline: Review
pros: Best place to work and learn.
cons: I found no cons in the work environment

headline: Only the product is good
pros: Couchbase product is really solid compared to other databases.    Smart people, good culture.
cons: Work is not exciting.  Don't go by what receruiters sale you.  Lots of people have left.  Pay is low,  not many perks compared to other similar companies.

headline: Graveyard!!
pros: Free Coffee, Free Coffee, Free Coffee, Free Coffee and more Free Coffee
cons: Leadership has no database experience. Company has expressed financial turmoil and currently looking for additional funding. No employee retention rate as we are losing more employees then hiring. No stability. Customer retention and new business are at an all time low!! Company culture is no existent as employees talk about each other as if we were back in high school.

headline: Usual challenges with a start up
pros: They have an interesting product and a smart group of people working there
cons: The communication to employees is low - especially for remote employees there is little guidance. As often with a start up it often feels like we are just moving too fast with no direction.

headline: Overall Great Company
pros: open and collaborative environment made it easier to not just do my job but plan for future projects.
cons: At the time I was there funding became an issue so some programs were scaled back significantly.  (I believe things have gotten better)

headline: great product, but poor sales leadership
pros: awesome product, smart people, company will do well for itself.
cons: no transparency, path to promotion, training/development. it doesn't seem sales leadership knows how to improve efficiency, and they won't take suggestions.

headline: More and more VPs
pros: Good product and well positioned
cons: Good people leaving due to lack of advancement opportunities

headline: Technical Role
pros: Strong distributed cache product offering
cons: Culture needed lots of work

headline: Great process so far
pros: Well organized an focussed on-boarding
cons: non to-date - just started my career here

headline: A good place to work
pros: small company, fast pace, nice work environment
cons: less flexible time, more pressure than big company

headline: People Development
pros: Recently, the Company is going big on professional development to help employees' growth internally and externally.
cons: Employee Retention have been difficult.

headline: Sales person grave yard
pros: Technology. Technology. Technology. and Technology
cons: Leadership has no database experience-running this once proud company into the ground fast.  I am seeing CB replacement projects all over the place.

headline: A company that actually lives their values
pros:
After just over a year at Couchbase I've had a chance to fully experience what it's really like. The past year was a challenging one in terms of the pressure to deliver a really important release but the senior leadership team were always there, willing to listen and give any support I needed.

At the end of the year we knew that important changes needed to be made in how we work, a complete ground up restart of our processes.

I am really impressed by the flexibility, support and encouragement we've had from senior leadership that has helped make the changes successful in a very short period of time.

Top down support and drive is key to any agile rollout and we had no shortage of that.
cons: The days can be long sometimes, but there is opportunity to be flexible.

headline: Really great team
pros:
- really great team
- helps us to grow
cons: - nothing much I can think of

headline: Preparing for Escape Velocity
pros: 2021 was a transformational year for Couchbase. Not only did we go public, but we launched Couchbase Capella which will be the next growth engine for BASE. The business continues to operate well and has all the tools necessary to get to the next several levels of acceleration. Now would be a great time to join!
cons: Given our growth and ambitions, we find it challenging to continue to add as many resources as we need to drive the business forward in the current environment.

headline: Great company with tonnes of opportunity.
pros: Great products. Latest technologies. Tonnes of opportunities to advance.
cons: Not known to me so far

headline: Good
pros: Find what works for you.
cons: Don't know, you need to keep up with the work.

headline: Nice place to work
pros: Nice place to work and learn.
cons: Not that i could of.

headline: mostly good
pros: good benefits, competitive salary, opportunities to move sideways within the organisation.
cons: a lot of tokenism - claims to support diversity with no actual program to implement change.

headline: Stay Away - broken
pros: none, literally nothing. I guess you get paid
cons:
beyond broken go to market. Same reps make all the money, they farm and farm a customer till the end. Impossible to get new logos. 
Management team is a joke, in it just to line their pockets and high five one another for not executing

headline: Amazing company
pros:
Couchbase is one of the only companies I've worked for that actually care about their employees.

Very talented people
cons: No real major downsides other than that it can sometimes feel like you have way too much to do. That can always be sorted out when speaking to your manager though.

headline: The genuine article - Mong-who?
pros:
Industry-leading tech that just works - many of the biggest companies in the world run their most critical applications on Couchbase

A company of good apples - I've never worked in a place where everyone is universally nice!

Hugely successful with massive upside - we are growing very well, with many initiatives and products on the cusp of helping us grow even faster. 

A leadership team that leads, cares and fosters a family culture from the top down.

A truly international company, with not just recognition but significant central resource available to support the field.

Everyone at Couchbase can be heard, and has the opportunity to make an impact.
cons:
There is some room for better diversity, but pleased to see big improvements in this area in the last 12 months.

A highly competitive market, which is good as the opportunity is huge, but it can get noisy out there.

In some areas of the market, there is a weird negative perception of Couchbase, perhaps based on experiences from long ago. It's weird in that I continuously hear directly from our customers on how much they love our products.

headline: Work is great but pay is not on par with industry
pros:
Good work-life balance
The learning path is there to explore multi-facet technology
cons:
The increment is not up to standard with market
No Perks
No extra benefits apart from salary
Office is not good

headline: Great company world class BDR Manager
pros: Great coaching very professional environment very unique company culture
cons: No real genuine cons if you work smart and hard you will be rewarded for your efforts.

headline: Great culture
pros: Great culture which is cultivated for the top down. IPO'd in 2021.
cons: Lacks awareness in the market relative to key competitors. Late to the SaaS game which has slowed growth.

headline: A company that genuinely values it's people
pros:
The teams and products are equally exciting and engaging. Every team member is invested in the products they build and support and are incredibly supportive and friendly.

I felt like a part of the team from the first moment I stepped through the virtual door. This is something hard to achieve in a physical office and we are told is extremely hard for a remote team but Couchbase has nailed it.

The onboarding process was incredibly slick, you are guided well through all aspects from IT ensuring your kit is working perfectly to HR ensuring you have access to key support apps and information and are signed up for the benefits correctly.

The kit you are given to do your job is well above anything I've experienced in much much larger organisations too. Couchbase also offer a fund to buy any equipment, furniture etc. to set up your home office as you need it to.

On top of all that the company values are centred around you as a human and the sentiment is genuine from the top down.
cons: Days can be pretty long depending on your role, there is a chance to flex and manage this yourself but it can be disruptive to your work life balance. It's not a 9-5 job.

headline: Best place I've ever worked
pros:
* Technical challenges are interesting and stimulating. 
* Products are capable of serving incredible use cases and we serve a stellar array of clients and industries. 
* Colleagues are motivated to make a difference. 
* Compared with other behemoths I've worked for there is very little bureaucracy restricting you from being able to get things done.
cons:
* Compared with legacy database companies it's relatively novel technology which means part of the challenge is education and awareness. 
* As with many (most?) technology companies it would be fantastic to see greater diversity - although I do feel the company extends itself to make every effort to encourage and promote this.

headline: Amazing company with amazing people.
pros:
Sense of community
Great benefits
Flexible working (family friendly)
Very thorough and informative onboarding
Approachable and strong leadership
cons: Global company so time zones can sometimes cause difficulties with communication in team.

headline: Fantastic so far
pros:
Very comprehensive onboarding program.
Couchbase has clearly put a lot of work into making sure all employees have a great idea of what we do, how we help others, and what the company values are.
cons: No cons as of yet.

headline: Great Company and Great Product but poor leadership
pros: Couchbase is a great company as a whole and provides a really great product. Pay and benefits were great and my family was cared for. I would recommend it to anyone not going to the cloud tram.
cons: When I joined the cloud team I was ready to provide world class DBaaS. However due to poor leadership the team is not allowed to do the job in the right way and is severely limited due to micromanagement. Leadership schedules team meetings only to cancel them nearly every week. Leadership needs an overhaul in order to tap the experience and talent of the team.

headline: Excellent Place to work
pros: Excellent work and excellent co-workers. You will get to work on cutting technology and problems, which keeps you challenging and sharpening your skills. Very good work life balance, balance you time between work, kids and hobbies too. Management has time to listen to everyone, and culture is to speak openly about you concerns, which are followed up and addressed diligently.
cons: None, been with CB for 5 years, and every day is an excellent day to learn something new.

headline: Great place to solve hard distributed database problems
pros:
Awesome challenges
Great Team, some of the best I worked with so far.
Creative Satisfaction
cons: Lacks hype that other competitors in this space enjoy, but that does not dampen the ride, at least for me as the Couchbase Platform beats the competing products on performance & scalability and presents good problems to solve. Hopefully, hype will follow soon.

headline: World Class Team
pros: Our culture, which is shown through our values is the strongest pro of Couchbase; treating people with kindness whilst still attacking difficult problems is possible in a software company. Compelling customer use cases and great partnerships mean there is also a big opportunity here.
cons: I don't have any cons

headline: Great Products, Great Leadership Team
pros: Great product, amazing list of big brand customers.
cons: Brand awareness in a crowded market and easy access to cloud products

headline: Great Culture, Tech, and Potential
pros: Solid product, many fortune 1000 current customers, excellent culture
cons: Brand recognition is improving with IPO

headline: Feels like home
pros: Super friendly staff, very willing to help - loads of in house training in order to get up to speed, way to many tools (yes a good thing) - young and exciting
cons: lacking in brand knowledge, but that is part of the job

headline: Lots of amazing people
pros:
A closely knit world class team.
Lots of talented indviduals.
Lots of opportunity for growth.
Employees are cares for.
cons: Cannot think of any downsides.

headline: Brilliant Company
pros:
Working at couchbase has been fantastic.

- Supportive manager
- Friendly team
- Lots of benefits
cons: I haven't experienced any cons.

headline: Great company with great support for remote working
pros: Couchbase has exciting tech to work on with lots of opportunities to make an impact due to the growing nature of the business. My role is fully remote and the support for this has been excellent. As my whole department is remote there is no "two-tier" system between on site and remote workers. They even provide a generous allowance for home office setup.
cons: Given that the team is distributes across Europe, America and Asia, working with time zone difference is a big change from someone used to being on site.

headline: The best place to work !
pros:
Motivating, stimulating, positive with lot's of high challenges!
People are always here to help you without judgment
cons: I see only positive people and work.

headline: Great to be part of it
pros: Freedom of initiative, great company culture, inclusive environment, super high tech product
cons: none stands out, I'm really satisfied

headline: World class team.
pros: Fast paced, common achievable goals across the entire team.
cons: None at the moment I can think of.

headline: Great company that cares about employees
pros:
Great company culture, very welcoming people and super supportive.
Interesting work.
cons: Distributed teams can mean working weird hours due to time zones.

headline: Wonderful place to Work!
pros: Dynamic team and Challenges, Great Product and wonderful opportunities to grow
cons: Nothing that I could think right now

headline: Great Company
pros: You will have a lot of things to learn in a friendly environment and surrounded by excellent people. The benefits are also great: besides a competitive salary you can get a yearly bonus, monthly payment for gym, health, transit.
cons: There are no cons at Couchbase.

headline: Good company but things can be better
pros:
Really good work culture
flexible timings and responsibility to work on your project
Really helped during pandemic by giving all the assurance to employee
cons:
No outing(not because of pandemic, but in general), No facilities, no perks, no culture specific to India team. If you are expecting any Fun activities from company, you gonna regret it. Their idea of fun is to host a small snack party once in a year
Really lagging in terms of corporate culture, like hiring process is mess.
Salary is not on par with market. Many candidates opted not to join for the lack of good offer
High attrition rate

headline: Great Company
pros:
amazing culture
amazing people
amazing values
great manager, super supportive and promotes growth
cons: none . . . . .

headline: An exciting trajectory
pros: What speaks loudest are that customers are explicitly outspoken about their association with Couchbase. The strategic, operational and commercial impact the technology delivers to their businesses is profound. The amazing culture is set right from the top and the LT not only have their people's interests at heart (genuinely, not just for PR purposes) but are highly experienced, the sharpest and most capable I've ever come across. This is a well organised business, unarguably offering the most performant, scalable and unique NoSQL DB available, which ultimately makes you proud to be a part of the journey.
cons: None that come to mind (aside of the fact there are quite a large number of systems and software tools to familiarise yourself with - most are geared towards helping you become more successful in any case and a rep is lucky to have such resources to go to market with).

headline: Great place to work and learn
pros:
1. Good salary
2. Flexible working hours
3. Friendly managers
cons:
1. Small office
2. Working with US teams might require you to attend call in the evening

headline: Very Fast Moving Company with Highly Talented Work Force
pros:
- Good Pay
- Good product to work on.
- The environment is very conducive to creativity.
- Very fast-moving, lots of learnings!
- The company is trying very hard to improve work-life balance.
- The recruitment team is highly skilled.
cons:
- Training given to new joiners can be more systematic(depends on the team). This way the new joiners will be much more productive right from day 1.
- Perks/Amenities can be improved.
- The office space is really small, talks to move to a new space has been stalled for a long time.

headline: Very good place to work
pros: Many benefits, friendly people, everyone is helpful
cons: Not many career opportunities. The marketing team is a bit weak.

headline: Nice place to be
pros: work life balance, great team work
cons: no cons at the moment

headline: Engineer's dream job
pros: Couchbase India does some pretty deep and cool technical work here. It is unusual to see this depth in product development and algorithms, even at high profile tech companies in India.  It's not for everyone (people are intellectually very sharp and driven - so one needs to be both smart and work hard to succeed here). But for the people that bat at the top of their game, this is the environment that will make them thrive and give them a great exposure and opportunity, both technically.
cons: Startup that's not yet profitable. It takes optimism to jump in and enjoy the ride despite the risks. But hopefully the eventual financial upside makes the risk taking worthwhile. That is the essence of startup, but also a Con -- because it only human  to seek stability and predictability.

headline: Good
pros:
- interesting tech stack
- good remote culture
cons: I haven't find any yet.

headline: Best Place to Work
pros:
1. Amazing people and awesome work culture. Feels like a family.
2. Good work-life balance
3. Flexible timings (in wfh), not sure about on-site 
4. Benefits are $50/month, medical insurance, gifts, etc 
5. Alot of learning opportunities
cons: No cons for now as I've recently joined

headline: Interesting technical challenges, flexible working. A slice of Silicon Valley in Manchester.
pros:
Super challenging, and deep technical work. Significant opportunities to deep-dive into database and distributed systems domains. Mostly open-source work, with many opportunities to contribute back upstream.

The best culture I've seen at both the company, and specifically a single office. The Manchester office retains that small startup feel, and has a very good reputation in the company. We punch well above our weight for the size, it's not just a small satellite office. Very flexible working and remote friendly. With any luck, you'll be able to visit HQ in California for a pretty unique (for the UK) Silicon Valley experience.

Exciting continuous growth for Couchbase. Approaching 2 years here and looking forward to what the future brings for the products and the company.
cons:
UK and West Coast timezones don't overlap much, so late morning starts and evening meetings are sometimes necessary.

Difficulty in growing engineering teams (including QE) due to the high bar set, which is positive in the end, but can be frustrating at times.

headline: Growing
pros: Many great learning opportunities are provided: organized technical enablement tasks, internal and external learning resources, and easy-to-use online demo environment.
cons: If you want to join a full-grown company, you better consider others.

headline: The most convenient recruitment.
pros: I work for two months at Couchbase. The interview process, initial absorption to work, training, personal attitude, and patient guidance, is what makes landing to a new company for a new hire, a hardworking and loyal employee in the shortest possible periods. I can say that I enjoyed the process I went through.
cons: As one who has only been in the company for two months, I have not found any shortcomings in the process or recommendations for change.

headline: Good People, Great Product
pros:
Good folks around, great team to work with. 
There's lots happening right now and work in pipeline looks great.
Flexible timing and work from home. 
Every member on the team has something to offer and its expands your knowledge.
cons:
So far, soo good. 
Probably the product training could be improved and chalk out a definite path to follow for a month or so in order for the onboarding process to be smoother and knowing the product better.

headline: Awesome product, lots to learn and grow
pros:
1) You are responsible for the feature that you choose to work on.
2) No micro management.
3) Free to work, whenever and however you want.
4) Loads to learn.
5) If you are big data enthusiast, then this is the right place for you.
cons:
1) Small office.
2) Office facilities can be improved.

headline: Great company to join
pros: Huge investment and rapid product development progress. Good planning of strategies.
cons: Not enough exposure and community development.

headline: Innovative Silicon Valley Tech Company
pros: Best technology, smart people, teamwork, easy going, flexible, training
cons: As remote worker it would be nice to meet more in person to feel like a team and connect to people better

headline: No Equal
pros:
- The culture of the people who work here is contagious 
- The values set by the company are unlike anything I've ever experienced. Many people's favourite being "Serve your family, as you define them"
- Working remotely
- The opportunity to determine how successful I am
cons: Working with people across different time zones has some challenges

headline: Great culture, modern tech ideas, Freedom to be an engineer
pros:
* Excellent management - all the way up to CEO level.
* Get the freedom to be an engineer in my position
* No lines between SRE and development - everybody is an engineer.
* Great product with a lot of well respected customers.
* Flexible working hours - work life balance is respected.
cons: * None come to mind at the moment, I have been very happy in my time here.

headline: Great company & positive energy
pros:
Great people with positive energy
Solid technology
Excellent Leadership team
cons:
some chaos as it is growing so quickly
rapid adoption of internal tools

headline: Amazing People, progressive culture. They care
pros: The people at Couchbase are the best that I've worked with! Our CEO Matt is a visionary and is progressive.  Huw the London GM is the absolute best -hardworking and consistent. The E-staff are some of the most intelligent that Ive worked with and people are generally normal, interesting and great to work with. The culture is flexible and you can feel the buzz of growth.
cons: Its hard work but thats expected

headline: Good product to work on, but not great company to work in!
pros:
Really good and very challenging quality work to work on. The technology space is a happening right now and will be in the foreseeable future, so good work is guaranteed for long time. 
The people I work with are extremely talented, down to earth and helpful people. It is good pleasure to work with such people.
cons:
- Virtually non existent perks. The pay is also way less than the average for the work that’s done.  The management keeps telling that they are working on it, but most of it seems to be an eyewash. 
- Very small workspace. With 40 plus people sitting in such small place, things get really crowded. In a tech company, having enough meeting rooms, adequate bathrooms are some of the basic necessities, which is clearly lacking in Bangalore office. 
- No clear career path defined. When the question is put repeatedly to the upper management about this, they give the same standard reply that things are in pipeline. But having worked for few years, I haven’t seen any concrete efforts being put in this area. 
- There is no way to give feedback about the manager and management. This is a crucial part of any good organisation. But no efforts seemed to be being made to address this issue. 
- Some teams are micro managed to great extent. This stifle talents and makes work environment not great to work at. 
- Lack of any team activities. All the management seems to care about is work. Or take the team out for lunch when some exec from the HQ visits. Other than this, there are no fun activities that happen in the office. 
- The management seems to waste quite a bit of money of the rare gifts to the employees. In an effort to give same gifts to all employees across the globe, HQ sends quite often useless gifts across. Most of the times we feel, if more thought couldn’t be put in the gift, just monetary equivalent would have been much more useful.

headline: Good company
pros:
1. You get to own the product you work on
2. Flexible timings and work from homes
3. Technical people
cons:
1. Pay is pretty low compared to other similar companies.
2. No office transport
3. No lunch
4. No wellness benefits
5. Very small office space (Very tiny)
6. No team building exercises

headline: NoEqual
pros: Working at the forefront of database technologies with a solution comparable by no other competitor
cons: I wish i had started sooner

headline: Worst Management in India
pros: Really good and very challenging quality work to work on. The technology space is a happening right now and will be in the foreseeable future, so good work is guaranteed for long time. The people I work with are extremely talented, down to earth and helpful people. It is good pleasure to work with such people.
cons: Virtually non existent perks. The pay is also way less than the average for the work that’s done. The management keeps telling that they are working on it, but most of it seems to be an eyewash. - Very small workspace. With 40 plus people sitting in such small place, things get really crowded. In a tech company, having enough meeting rooms, adequate bathrooms are some of the basic necessities, which is clearly lacking in Bangalore office. - No clear career path defined. When the question is put repeatedly to the upper management about this, they give the same standard reply that things are in pipeline. But having worked for few years, I haven’t seen any concrete efforts being put in this area. - There is no way to give feedback about the manager and management. This is a crucial part of any good organisation. But no efforts seemed to be being made to address this issue. - Some teams are micro managed to great extent. This stifle talents and makes work environment not great to work at. - Lack of any team activities. All the management seems to care about is work. Or take the team out for lunch when some exec from the HQ visits. Other than this, there are no fun activities that happen in the office. - The management seems to waste quite a bit of money of the rare gifts to the employees. In an effort to give same gifts to all employees across the globe, HQ sends quite often useless gifts across. Most of the times we feel, if more thought couldn’t be put in the gift, just monetary equivalent would have been much more useful.

headline: Great place to work
pros: I have been here less than a year, so far a great place to work .
cons: None come to mind right now.

headline: Monty Python Sales Management
pros:
- Great technology and engineering management
- The tech teams have a great vision and roadmap of where they want to be
cons:
- Poor sales leadership - changed quotas too often, extended FY to give appearance of good performance. You cannot make this up, these guys are amateurs.
- No HR strategy - one key employee leaves they promote several people to VP to give the appearance of advancement
- Talk a lot about culture while killing it
- Refused to pay full commission to top deal earners! 
- A lot of tailors for naked emperors
- Very poor pay and benefits
- Sales heads think bullying and shouting at reps will bring results, it just brings vacant positions

headline: Accounts & Collections Specialist
pros: Flexible work timings, Friendly environment, opportunities to learn
cons: Not seen any as joined just 2months

headline: Great People, Great Leadership, Great Vision
pros:
- Inspiring vision with focus on building for sustainable success
- Fast-moving. Big decisions get focused and acted on expediently. Benefits from a lack of legacy infrastructure
- Great tech. Great client list
- Hard-working but supportive of work/life balance
- Open and fair culture
- Very strong leadership team. CEO is popular and respected
cons:
- A number of the biggest and most successful clients won't let us shout about them using Couchbase!!! Not big enough yet to challenge this
- Has been a bit centralised but that's changing as the company grows
- Friends think I work for a furniture company.

headline: Come on challenge yourself!
pros: Great working environment and lots of interesting customers to work with. Couchbase have a great technology and reputation with existing customers for going the extra mile to make mutual success. Lots of opportunity to grow and a good mix of skills in the company.
cons: A bit chaotic as the company is growing but its normal growing pains rather than any structural challenges.

headline: Great Company!
pros:
- Great company with a truly market leading product
- The leadership team from manager to CEO the best I have ever worked with. They are transparent, approachable and willing to help with anything.
- We work hard because we want to, but the culture is highly customer focussed and not pressurised.
- You feel valued as a part of the bigger picture, not just a name or number.
- Great compensation and benefit package
- Onboarding is second to none.
- Really is on the way to great things!
cons: - Literally I cannot think of any!

headline: Great People and Interesting Work
pros: What makes it incredibly fun to work at Couchbase is the people. The product is also quite versatile so you will have the opportunity to work on new projects that spark your interest.
cons: At times, it can seem a bit difficult to find the help or information you need but that's the nature of working in a startup. Management is in the process of streamlining the tools and processes though so hopefully this will improve with time.

headline: Great company and a lot of challenges!
pros:
Agile and really motivating topics. 
A lot of travels, great place to meet various companies, understanding their technological challenges.
Nice people and easy working with different levels in the company.
cons:
A lot of things on the plate.
You have to be autonomous and like to work sometime alone.

headline: Forward Looking Company Focused on Greatness
pros: Great customers, Great People, Great Products and a rare opportunity to join a company on a great growth path!
cons: Growth in all areas can be challenging and requires focus but nothing that the team is not addressing.

headline: Coder's heaven
pros:
* Every other person you speak to is smarter than you.
* You get to work in Golang, Erlang, C++.
* Flexible timings.
* Friendly people.
* Very good pay.
cons:
* Small office space.
* No cab service.
* No lunch served except on Thursdays.

headline: Great place to work
pros:
- Technical and highly qualified team 
- Great work culture and technology 
- Helpful peers 
- You get to code in Go :)
- Great salaries and good management
- WFH
cons: - Can't think of any

headline: Hard work but rewarding
pros:
- amazing work environment
- from colleagues to managers everyone is very nice and helpful 
- Love the company culture
- Fun place to work 
- Amazing technology to sell/ Big opportunities
cons: Nothing that I can think of

headline: Great Place to Work
pros:
- Awesome, open, transparent work environment.
- Technically very strong colleagues. No compromise on talent.
- Roadmap is clear to everyone. 
- ~Zero office politics.
cons: Nothing as such. May be late night meetings.

headline: Great product and technology
pros: Really advanced product. It covers many NoSQL - Big Data features. Really talented team.
cons: Work-life balance sometimes in danger. Big competition.

headline: Excellent Company
pros: Excellent product within the market, fantastic culture and great atmosphere in the office. Travel to the US for training is great. Would really recommend Couchbase.
cons: Be prepared for a fast-changing environment!

headline: Great Company
pros: Great Product, very smart people, flexible work and relaxed environment
cons: As I work remotely I don't think that I'm really part of a team.

headline: Mediocre
pros: Massive market; Kickass dev team;  Interesting tech  problems
cons: Too top-heavy; Broken processes; lack of accountability; blame game politics and culture

headline: Great Company!
pros: Great Company with a fantastic management and product!
cons: none since now .

pros: Fast paced, great team, excellent product
cons: Growing pains with a startup
